column3: Concept ACK, obviously :) Thanks @vasild  !\n\nMind also integrating https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19845#discussion_r495730125 as that change was unneeded?

Well, I left it as is because

```cpp
template <typename E>
bool operator()(const E& e) const {
```

is more generic than

```cpp
bool operator()(const std::runtime_error& e) const {
```

both work now but the former would also work if the exception does not inherit `std::runtime_error`.

I don't think the template function is required to make exception handling more generic for the following reasons:\n- all custom types in the project inherit from `std::runtime_error`\n- if this seems insufficient, the base `std::exception` type could be used
Please describe the actual changes in the pr title/description?
